vars.personalinformationline: Welcome to my personal page! I am a Computer Science major Ph.D. Student at Syracuse University. My main research area is Solid State Drive (SSD) optimization, but I am also interested in Computer Networking, Network Security, Social Engineering and et cetera.
vars.educationphdend: ) in Computer Science at Syracuse University (2020-)
vars.educationms: M.S. in Computer Science at New York University Tandon School of Engineering (2018-2019)
vars.educationbachelor: B.A. in German Studies (w. Honors)/B.S. in Mathematics Computer Science at University of California, San Diego (2014-2018)
vars.educationdescription: Due to this reason, my research interest is not limited in Computer Science field as well. I am also interested in history (modern German/Chinese history), linguistics (especially Comparison Linguistics between Indo-European and Germantic langauges, and Chinese/Japanese/Korean comparison), and history-related politics (as an objective, third-party observer). I speak Chinese, English and German.
vars.publicationsline: As a new Ph.D. Student, I have no publicated papers as for now. Stay tuned!

vars._pub_template_authors: Xiangqun Zhang, Shuyi Pei, Jongmoo Choi, Bryan S. Kim
vars._pub_template_title: Excessive SSD Internal Parallelism Considered Harmful
